conclusion: Analyze flow paths to predict which container will collect liquid from points A, B, C, and D.
Image shows starting points (A, B, C, D) at the top and containers (E, F) at the bottom with red arrows indicating flow direction.
Images show colorful streams flowing from each point with baffles redirecting paths.
Blue liquid flows straight down from point A, encountering obstacles but mostly along the left side, connecting to container E.
Teal liquid from point B flows downward, redirected by a black baffle toward the left, merging with other streams and reaching container E.
Yellow liquid flows down from point C, redirected by a red baffle toward the left, joining other streams flowing toward container E.
Orange liquid flows downward from point D, redirected by a purple baffle toward the left, joining other streams flowing toward container E.
All four liquids are redirected by baffles and flow toward the left side, ultimately into container E.
Final Answer: All liquids from points A, B, C, and D will flow into container E.
